originalText.text: As a leasing manager in P.A my first time using the Guarantor program was much easier than I had anticipated. Alex from the Guarantor program was quick to pick up my call and assist me through my first procedure. It's nice to know there is a great support system set in place with people like Alex being a phone call away when needed while processing an application.  Thank you!

It's nice to know there is a great support system set in place with people like Alex being a phone call away when needed while processing an application.  Thank you!

originalText.text:
It is truly surprising to me how this company seemingly has all these great reviews on Google! As someone who moved to the US fairly recently, I was forced by the building I was renting from (Magnolia Dumbo) to use the Guarantors even though I met the rental requirements with my income and my sister and her husband were also more than willing to act as my guarantors to prove I was good for the rent. All this because I did not have US history, despite showing them my perfect UK credit score of 999/999. I’ve now built
up enough credit history to not need to use the guarantors anymore (thank God). I recently moved out of Magnolia Dumbo, and I got an email from the Guarantors l, stating that I was in lease default and needed to pay back some money which they had paid to my previous landlord. I was shocked, as I was not informed there was any lease default, and I was, in fact, told that I was in good standing upon inspection of the apartment when I moved out. I contacted the guarantors, who then explained that it was actually my final electricity bill paid on my behalf, and I would need to reimburse them. Since then, I have been trying to contact the Guarantors, to understand why I still need to make a reimbursement, despite the fact that I paid nearly one month rent to them, which I was told would be non-refundable, and would act as a security deposit replacement for my building. So far, the only thing that the Guarantors have managed to guarantee me is utter frustration. This feels like a total rip off and legitimized scam, and I am shocked that this type of service is allowed. They claim that they are taking on the risk of taking me on as a tenant, because I have no credit history, But there were other ways in which they could have proved my credit worthiness. I can only assume that New York rental buildings and the guarantors are in collusion to make money off people like me who have no choice but to pay this money because we need a place to live when we move to the US.  I am so glad I will hopefully never have to use this company again. I truly do feel sorry for foreigners like me who move to the US and have to deal with a company like this.

originalText.text: I am beyond grateful for the Guarantors. Without them, I would not have been able to sign a contract for my beloved apartment in New York. Customer service was extremely supportive and answered all my questions immediately and in sufficient detail. They were extremely fast in providing me a guarantee and confirming to my landlord. My overall experience was awesome. I can only recommend the Guarantors to anybody who is moving to the US.

originalText.text:
TheGuarantors are absolutely awesome! I’ve used their services twice now, once in obtaining a lease, again to renew, and my experiences with this company are excellent.

Communication from everyone within TheGuarantors is very quick and they are always ready to answer any questions. The process of working with them in tandem with my apartment’s management is smooth and simple.

I highly recommend TheGuarantors!

originalText.text: Just finished everything up with Guarantors! It was a pleasure working with them getting us into our new apartment home. They are are amazing friendly and knowledgeable,and helped our process with ease. Highly recommend! Now just waiting on the rest of the process with housing to get us in sooner than later ,, Approximately 2 weeks they said as it needs inspected and whatnot!  Thanks guys , you made our part a lot easier for us!
